title: Kintaikyo Bridge + Mountain Rest Stop
content:
This morning we were taken to Iwakuni to see the Kintaikyo Bridge, with its famous 5 arches span.

Iwakuni is a really nice quiet town. We made our way over the bridge and found a coffee shop - a most important stop before we could continue! This place was quirky and slow, looking like it was recently renovated and the owners / staff were in no hurry haha. It was fun, and the coffee was strong, making for a nice unique experience.

After the coffee stop, we continued our way towards the ropeway up the mountainside where we then walked to a castle perched on top. This castle was much smaller than Himeji, and had a small exhibition inside showing traditional weapons and armour mostly. While neat, the main attraction were the views from the top - looking out over the city with its winding river to the sea in the distance was really cool.

We made our way back to the bus which then took us to a mountain rest stop which specialised in traditional "bandit" dishes - most notably chicken with a teriyaki glaze cooked on a skewer over fire. The whole place was awesome! The property was nestled in amongst the mountains with shops, buildings and sprawling seating in the area behind the entrance - it was such a unique and beautiful place to enjoy a lovely meal.

After lunch we were off to our next hotel in Fukuoka, all the way onto a different island (Kyushu).
